quiz.title: Using ん (の) to Soften Statements

bank.question: Which sentence correctly uses ん?
options: 今日は雨が降るんです。
今日は雨が降るですん。
今日は雨んが降るです。

bank.question: Which pattern is required to use ん(の)です after a noun?
bank.explanation: When using ん(の)です after a noun, you need to add な before ん(の)です.

bank.question:
Fill in the blank with any adjective that you find appropriate (using Hiragana or Kanji):

今日は____です。
bank.sample_answer: 今日はいそがしいんです。

bank.question:
Translate the following sentence into English:

明日[あした]しけんがあるんです。今日はあそべないんです。
bank.sample_answer: Tomorrow I have an exam. So I can't hang out today.
